page.title: 08INDUSTRY IN LITTLE BADDOW
page.content: Although Little Baddow is primarily an agricultural area there are a few pockets of industry to be found in the outlying areas of the village. The geological survey of the area shows that the village is built on deposits of sand and gravel, and there is a sand pit near the village which quarries sand for use in the construction industry. The sand pit is a further example of the way in which the natural resources of the land are used to provide Little Baddow with its livelihood. A further type of industry in Little Baddow has arisen from the concentration of agriculture in the area. For example a Mushroom farm and a Chicken farm have been set up. This is a modern form of intensive farming designed specifically to achieve mass production in the food industry.
